objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is the author and publisher of this report, providing analysis, detection rules, and recommendations regarding the Devil Bait malware.

objects.name: C2 domain
objects.description: Primary command and control (C2) domain used by Devil Bait for second-stage payload delivery, beaconing, and exfiltration.

objects.name: C2 URL for downloading second stage
objects.description: URL used by the initial macro to retrieve the second-stage VBScript from the C2 server.

objects.name: C2 URL for exfiltration
objects.description: URL used by the malware to exfiltrate system enumeration data to the C2 server.

objects.name: C2 URL for beaconing
objects.description: URL used by the scheduled task for periodic beaconing and retrieval of further payloads.

objects.name: URL embedded in document
objects.description: Malicious URL embedded in the document's VBScript, used to retrieve and execute additional code.

objects.name: Domain embedded in document
objects.description: Malicious domain referenced in embedded VBScript for additional payload delivery.

objects.name: First-stage VBScript dropper
objects.description: Path where the first-stage VBScript is written and executed by the malicious macro.

objects.name: System enumeration output
objects.description: Path where system enumeration data is written by the second-stage script.

objects.name: Encoded system enumeration data
objects.description: Path where base64-encoded system enumeration data is stored before exfiltration.

objects.name: Registry key modified by embedded VBScript
objects.description: Registry key modified by embedded VBScript to prevent Internet Explorer from diverting to a homepage.

objects.name: Registry key modified by embedded VBScript
objects.description: Registry key modified by embedded VBScript to prevent Internet Explorer from checking whether it is the default browser.

objects.name: Indicator for 체불확인원-김보라.doc (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document used as the initial infection vector.

objects.name: Indicator for 체불확인원-김보라.doc (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document used as the initial infection vector.

objects.name: Indicator for 체불확인원-김보라.doc (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document used as the initial infection vector.

objects.name: Indicator for data.txt (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious VBScript file retrieved as the second stage from the C2 server.

objects.name: Indicator for data.txt (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious VBScript file retrieved as the second stage from the C2 server.

objects.name: Indicator for data.txt (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious VBScript file retrieved as the second stage from the C2 server.

objects.name: devil bait
objects.description: Devil Bait is a malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document targeting Korean speakers. It downloads and runs a second-stage VBScript. Both stages use 'living off the land' binaries (LOLbins) for execution, system enumeration, registry modification, and persistence. The malware achieves persistence via a Scheduled Task beaconing every 10 minutes, collects system enumeration data using Windows binaries, and exfiltrates this data over HTTP to a C2 server. Devil Bait masquerades as AhnLab, a legitimate security product, in its persistence mechanism. The malware uses multiple stages for flexibility and defense evasion, and its second-stage script can be updated or replaced by the threat actor.

objects.name: AhnLab
objects.description: AhnLab is a legitimate endpoint security product in South Korea. Devil Bait masquerades as AhnLab in its persistence mechanism to evade detection.

objects.name: Kimsuky
objects.description: Kimsuky is a threat actor group previously observed using the technique of masquerading as AhnLab for persistence. The use of the string 'Update' in autorun names (e.g., AhnlabUpdate) is also associated with this group. The report notes that Devil Bait's persistence TTPs are similar to those used by Kimsuky actors.

objects.name: T1059
objects.description: Devil Bait uses the WScript shell from within other scripts to spawn cmd.exe instances to collect system information.

objects.name: T1053.005
objects.description: Devil Bait creates a Scheduled Task to beacon every 10 minutes.

objects.name: T1071.001
objects.description: Devil Bait Command and Control is achieved over HTTP using the scripting object ServerXMLHTTP.

objects.name: T1041
objects.description: Devil Bait sends system enumeration data over HTTP to the C2 server.

objects.name: T1036.004
objects.description: Devil Bait masquerades as AhnLab, a legitimate security product, in its persistence mechanism.

objects.name: DevilBait_vbscript_2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_vbscript_2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "These strings appear in second stage VBScript used
by Devil Bait."

    strings:
       $ = "WScript.Shell" nocase
       $ = "Scripting.FileSystemObject" nocase
       $ = "MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0" nocase
       $ = "FolderExists" nocase
       $ = "certutil" nocase
       $ = "vbCrLf" nocase
       $ = "expandenvironmentstrings" nocase
       $ = "%appdata%" nocase
    condition:

    filesize < 20KB and all of them

}

objects.name: DevilBait_Maldoc
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_Maldoc {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "These strings appear in the Devil Bait malicious
document."

    strings:

   $word = "MSWordDoc"
   $ms_xml = "MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0"
   $ = {53 65 6E 64 3A 45 78 65 63 75 74 65 28 [1-6] 2E 72 65 73 70

6F 6E 73 65 54 65 78 74 29}// Send:Execute(<variable>.responseText)

   $ = "wscript.exe //e:vbscript"

    condition:

    all of them

}

objects.name: DevilBait_C2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_C2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "C2 and IoC strings found in Devil Bait second
stage vbscript."

    strings:
       $file_1 = "sr011.xml"

       $must_func = "Roller"
       $must_C2 = ".co.kr"

       $c2_1 = "cross.php"
       $c2_2 = "report.php"
       $c2_3 = "list.php"
       $c2_4 = "show.php"
    condition:
        $file_1 and any of ($must_*) and any of ($c2_*)
}

objects.name: DevilBait_vbscript_1
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_vbscript_1 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies the first stage vbscript
written to disk e.g. version.xml."

    strings:
        $must_1 = "On Error Resume Next:Set"
        $must_2 = "CreateObject(\"MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0\"):"
        $must_3 = ".Send:Execute("
        $must_4 = "http"
        $get = "GET"
        $post = "POST"
    condition:

    filesize < 10KB and all of ($must*) and ($get or $post)

}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Devil Bait
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. devil bait.
